than in <u>Waldheimia <\u> - They exhibit 
only a few longitudinal folds and not only 
present the same deficiency of muscular 
fibres as those of <u>Waldheimia <\u> but are so 
tied by the bands which support them 
that it is difficult to conceive how 
muscular fibres even if they existed 
could act - The ‘ventricles’ in like 
manner lie obliquely in the parietes 
of the body & simply present villous 
eminences on their inner surface,
which has a yellowish colour.
All these ‘hearts’ exhibit the same curious 
relation with the genitalia in <u>Rhynchonella <\u> 
as in <u>Waldheimia <\u>; that is to say a 
‘genital band’ proceeds from the base 
of the ‘ventricle’ & becomes the axis 
of the curiously reticulated genital 
organ - But in <u>Rhynchonella <\u> the 
genital band of the upper genitalia comes 
from its own ‘heart’ -
